CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 16, 1961, pg. A27, reads: "FACE PLAY-OFF WITH SMITHS - This challenging Broadway team will face the high ranking Tommy Smiths, this week, for the right to meet the front-running Porkys, for the Ammon Slow Pitch Softball League title. From left to right, front row: Eddie Williams, Reginald Franklin, Russell Jackson, Tom Motley, James Ginyard.  Back row: Coach Reginald Rose, Coach Hubert Kelly, Billy Robinson, Coach Warner Taylor, Charles Evans, Leroy Harris, Eugene Haley, Melvin Cooper, Charles Jones, and John Kisic, sponsor. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Broadway Cafe baseball team, squatting in front: Eddie Williams, Reginald Franklin, Russell Jackson with glove and softball, Tom Motley, James Ginyard; back row including Coach Reginald Rose, Coach Hubert Kelly, Billy Robinson, Coach Warner Taylor, Charles Evans, Leroy Harris, Eugene Haley, Melvin Cooper, Charles Jones, and sponsor John Kisic, posed on Ammon field with swing sets in background
